comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: The US Government Building was designed by W J Edbrooke according to a list copied from 1897's A History of the World's Columbian Exposition. Glimpses of the World's Fair lists it as 415 feet by 345 feet, six acres floor area, 236 foot dome, cost $400,000.

comment.author: 29398281@N04
comment._content: I used this picture for my vocab binder which is a final project for my History of Architecture and Interior Design class.  I'm majoring in Interior Design at Southwest University of Visual Arts.  The pictures are wonderful and this structure was beautiful!  It's a shame that much of it is gone and that it was originally intended to be "temporary".

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
Thanks for letting us know mj11snoopy. Hope we helped you get an A!
It is amazing how much trouble they went to to build ephemeral works.
Deb Wythe
brooklyn Museum Digital Lab
